评论概述: Dickies has used the wrong length (5 inches) zipper.  They should be 6 or 7 inches.
评论详情: The zipper is too short (5 inches).  The size on most of Dickies other pants are 6 or 7 inches. The color and style look great, but the pants don't fit right.  Did Dickies mix up the zippers that may have been used on children's clothes or as side zippers.  If Dickies makes these cargo pants with the right zipper length then I would certainly buy them.  Please look into the situation.  Also the button is too big for the button hole.  It needs to be easier, but secure to work.

评论概述: Best work pants for the money.
评论详情: Ive bought these consistently the past 5 years, and theyre the best. My job is harsh to clothes, but these hold up extremely well. Comfortable, they always fit great, and hardly shrink after 100s of times in the dryer. Highly reccomend.

As someone who works in a body shop and demands both comfort and durability from their workwear, I couldn't be more satisfied with the Dickies Men's Slim-Straight Pants. Purchasing several pairs for my work rotation, these pants have exceeded my expectations in every aspect.  First and foremost, the fit is impeccable. The slim-straight design offers a modern silhouette without sacrificing comfort or mobility. Whether I'm bending, crouching, or reaching, these pants move with me effortlessly, making long days in the shop much more manageable.  As expected from Dickies, the quality of the materials and construction is top-notch. The fabric is sturdy and holds up well to the demands of my work environment, resisting tears, stains, and abrasions with ease. I have no doubt that these pants will withstand the rigors of daily wear and tear for a long time to come.  But perhaps the most surprising aspect of these pants is the confidence boost they provide. There's something about slipping into a well-fitting pair of Dickies that makes you feel like you can conquer the day. And I have to admit, they even make me feel a bit "bonita," as the saying goes.  In conclusion, the Dickies Men's Slim-Straight Pants are a solid choice for anyone in need of dependable workwear with a stylish flair. Comfortable, durable, and confidence-boosting, these pants embody everything you'd expect from the Dickies brand and more. Whether you're working in a body shop or tackling tasks around the house, these pants have you covered. Highly recommended!

评论概述: Seems Bigger than they used to be
评论详情: I used to wear these in 30/30. But 30 waist apparently no longer fits me in Dickies pants. I'd suggest considering ordering a size down if you're slim like me. Other than that they are great work pants the older pair I do have that fit. Durable, not too heavy, not too light.

Writing a review for these was must! I had gone through buying 4 different pairs to find a fit, but 1 of them were from a different brand. One thing I will start off with is that dickies does not offer anything below the length of 30. It's disappointing because apparently 29 is the perfect length for me.  My review is a must because I know I had a hard time finding my size so anyone similar will struggle. I'm a male standing at 5'3 weighing in at 165lbs. This means that I'm very short with some width (more of a muscular shape). Important to note because some pants seem too slim and too wide while not being long enough.  The regular fit and relaxed straight are both toooo baggy at the bottom. Idk how anyone finds comfort in those bell bottom of a pant. The waist was a bit tight but still very comfortable. I bought these slim fit at 32W x 30L and they are almost perfect. They are a bit baggy but doesn't look too bad and lil tight so I may try the 34W but I feel like a 33W would have hit the nail. Once again, none available at that size.  If you are looking for a uniform look, these are absolutely perfect. The slim pants provide professional uniform look, the pockets are functional and it comes with a crease down the front legs as well. Very durable as described with moisture wicking and etc. The material is great, and comfortable. The only other downside is the waist doesn't have any give. Which has me a bit concerned if I ever need to tuck in my work shirt. Might be the universe telling me to hit the gym lol  an idea for dickies would be to add some elastic material to the waist that will allow stretch for tucking shirts. In the winter I'd normally tuck in a warm under layered shirt, a tee, and then my uniform shirt.
The front pocket are very shallow, all my other Dickies are deep pockets.  Manufacturers defect
You can't go wrong with some Dickies  pants good quality for the price. The only con I have is sizing no half sizes go a half size up from your regular size
A little tighter on the waist but durable and great as work pants. They do fade to a tinted purple after a couple of washes but with black dye detergent it keeps is black for some time.

With seven, yes seven! belt loops there will be no butt crack shown while wearing these pants.  Most of my pants have five loops, so I appreciate the seven, especially when I bend down a bit.  I was hoping that the material would be a bit thicker as they are not exactly the warmest garment I own (cheap jeans are much thicker and warmer).  One other thing is the positioning of the pockets.  The cargo pockets on the legs are positioned so that something like a car key fob will bounce against the lower leg,  even below the knee area.  I do also wish they had a waist 29 version as the 30 is a bit big for me, though I love the 32 inch length.
this are not stretch or flex removed tags so cant return waist of money

The pockets are cut small and hard to get my hand in. No, I don't have big hands. The zipper fly is cut small as well, making it difficult to use the men's room. They have zero style. I'm disappointed because I used to like their clothing and their reputation. I will giver these away to someone who has no pants.
